verses.kjv: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,
verses.ct: From Paul, chosen as an apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, and from our brother Sosthenes —

verses.kjv: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:
verses.ct: To God's church in Corinth, to those who have been set apart in Christ Jesus, called to be his holy people, along with everyone everywhere who calls on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord — their Lord and ours:

verses.kjv: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace come to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
verses.ct: I always thank my God for you because of the grace of God that has been given to you through Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge;
verses.ct: Through him you have been made rich in every way — in your ability to speak and in your understanding.

verses.kjv: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:
verses.ct: This happened as the message about Christ was firmly established among you.

verses.kjv: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: As a result, you don't lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to return.

verses.kjv: Who shall also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: He will also keep you strong all the way to the end, so that you will be without fault on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: God is faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
verses.ct: God is faithful, and he is the one who invited you into a relationship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.kjv: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I urge you in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to be united in what you say. There should be no splits among you. Instead, be completely joined together, sharing the same perspective and the same purpose.

verses.kjv: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them which are of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.
verses.ct: Because some members of Chloe's household have informed me, my brothers and sisters, that there is quarreling among you.

verses.kjv: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.
verses.ct: What I mean is that each of you is saying, 'I follow Paul,' or 'I follow Apollos,' or 'I follow Cephas,' or 'I follow Christ.'

verses.kjv: Is Christ divided? was Paul crucified for you? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?
verses.ct: Has Christ been split into pieces? Was Paul nailed to a cross for you? Were you baptized in Paul's name?

verses.kjv: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;
verses.ct: I'm grateful to God that I didn't baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

verses.kjv: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.
verses.ct: so that no one can claim they were baptized in my name.

verses.kjv: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.
verses.ct: Oh, I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Beyond that, I can't remember baptizing anyone else.

verses.kjv: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.
verses.ct: Because Christ didn't send me to baptize but to proclaim the good news — and not with clever rhetoric, so that the cross of Christ wouldn't lose its power.

verses.kjv: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.
verses.ct: The message of the cross sounds like nonsense to those who are on the path to destruction, but to us who are being saved, it is the power of God.

verses.kjv: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'I will demolish the wisdom of the wise, and I will discard the intelligence of the intelligent.'

verses.kjv: Where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disputer of this world? hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
verses.ct: So where does that leave the philosopher? The scholar? The skilled debater of this age? Hasn't God exposed the wisdom of this world as foolishness?

verses.kjv: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.
verses.ct: Since, in God's wisdom, the world failed to know God through its own wisdom, God was pleased to save those who believe through the apparent foolishness of the message we proclaim.

verses.kjv: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:
verses.ct: Jewish people demand miraculous signs, and Greek people search for wisdom,

verses.kjv: But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;
verses.ct: but we proclaim Christ crucified — an offense to Jewish people and absurdity to Greek people.

verses.kjv: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.
verses.ct: But to those who are called, both Jewish and Greek, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.

verses.kjv: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.
verses.ct: Because what seems foolish about God is wiser than human wisdom, and what seems weak about God is stronger than human strength.

verses.kjv: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, are called:
verses.ct: Just consider your own calling, brothers and sisters. By human standards, not many of you were considered wise. Not many were powerful. Not many came from prestigious families.

verses.kjv: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;
verses.ct: Instead, God chose what the world considers foolish to shame the wise, and God chose what the world considers weak to shame the strong.

verses.kjv: And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen, yea, and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:
verses.ct: God chose what the world looks down on and despises — even things that count for nothing — to overthrow the things that seem to matter,

verses.kjv: That no flesh should glory in his presence.
verses.ct: so that no human being could boast in his presence.

verses.kjv: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:
verses.ct: It is because of God that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God, as well as righteousness, holiness, and redemption.

verses.kjv: That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
verses.ct: So, as Scripture puts it, 'Whoever boasts should boast about the Lord.'
